name: Bromoethane
desc: Bromoethane, also known as ethyl bromide, is a chemical compound of the haloalkanes group. It is abbreviated by chemists as EtBr (which is also used as an abbreviation for ethidium bromide). This volatile compound has an ether-like odour.

images.alt: Ball and stick model of bromoethane

Solubility: miscible with ethanol, ether, chloroform, organic solvents
LC50 (median concentration):
26,980 ppm (rat, 1 hr)
16,230 ppm (mouse, 1 hr)
4681 ppm (rat)
2723 ppm (mouse)[3]
LCLo (lowest published):
3500 ppm (mouse)
24,000 ppm (guinea pig, 30 min)
7000 ppm (guinea pig, >4.5 hr)[3]
Related alkanes:
Bromomethane
Bromoiodomethane
n-Propyl bromide
2-Bromopropane
tert-Butyl bromide
standard state:
